head.title: Before Ordering Surf, Read About Turf

hedline.hl1: Before Ordering Surf, Read About Turf

abstract.p: National Audubon Society publishes Seafood Lover's Almanac, colorful guide ($19.95) to the habitats of various fish, crustaceans and mollusks and the methods used to catch them; photo (S)

block.p: The National Audubon Society, which is concerned about the finned as well as the feathered, has published the Seafood Lover's Almanac, a colorful guide ($19.95) to the habitats of various fish, crustaceans and mollusks and the methods used to catch them. There are also some cooking tips and recipes. Each species is rated, from green to yellow to red -- with red being the worst -- on the Audubon Fish Scale, a gauge of whether it is endangered and whether harvesting methods cause pollution or threaten other species. Among the imperiled are the Patagonian toothfish (a k a Chilean sea bass) and swordfish. (King mackerel, above, gets a green.) To order: (888) 397-6649.
